channel.title: Digimon vs Pokemon
channel.description:
Reyx7 thinks digimon < pokemon, but i say digimon > pokemon
let me tell you a story:
Digimon First came out as tamagotchis [img]http://t0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQfSBQD0EqFECwePVMMe0KtMZdCbeNFQCqK-VXqWICsaA7qTaPERROnpVs_[/img] notice the digi-vice looks similar. [img]http://t1.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRSdw-9lWgAGTk4UhIEzVuhNRC_9NSVaFeHtxzThKSKNGFauPPZu50XE_9Y[/img]
exactly the same. yes next came "tamagotchi Digivice" which you see up there. after that, pokemon came out in 1995. and people got to know it better then the tamagotchi Digivice. but pokemon saw how well Digimon was doing and before the games or the show, they made there own "Virtual Pikachu" [img]http://pokemonsafari.net/static/i/pokemon-pikachu/pokemon-pikachu-grande.png[/img] notice how it looks like a gameboy? but it still has the tamagotchi based Design on the game. in this case. there would be no pokemon without digimon.
next the show and games came out in late 1995, after the V.P, Digimon, looking how Pokemon and gamefreak were doing decided to give they're creation a go, and created a very popular show. Digimon Tamers.
Digimon: a show about a group of kids/teens trying to save the digital world pokemon: a bratty 10 year old kid trys to become a pokemon master.
in my opinion the digimon storyline was the greatest.
What do you guys think? [img]http://fc08.deviantart.net/fs71/f/2010/073/8/7/pokemon_vs_digimon_no_contest_by_shadowfox1277.jpg[/img]

item.title: Digimon vs Pokemon
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I had the Tamagotchi things and the Digimon handheld devices as a kid. Also had most of the Pokemon games and watched both the shows, and I can say I well enjoyed the combination of both. I remember that the Pokemon games had more of an RPG aspect while the Digimon games were more fast paced and action games, so I can’t really compare that. As for the shows, I found both of them pretty cool as a kid. As for the cards, I always played Yu-Gi-Oh for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Digimon vs Pokemon
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:47, topic:434093”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=536811.msg3926093#msg3926093 date=1330225696]
Digimon - Manga and concept developed 1998 - Anime aired 1999 - Merchandise following suit.
Pokemon - Manga and concept developed 1996 - Anime and merchandise followed suit.

Pokemon is better in my opinion simply for the games however as far as television series aired in the US, I would say Zoids is better than both of these.

[/quote]
i never heard of zoids

and @topic
There’s a reason that pokemon games are still being sold and very popular amongst kids you know
and pokemon is still an ongoing show
but the new pokemon is kinda stupid i havent watched it since diamond and pearl started but
black and white? those pokemon names are so hard that i can probably watch 3 full episodes before i can even learn the name

[quote author=mironic link=topic=536811.msg3926107#msg3926107 date=1330226503]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=536811.msg3925965#msg3925965 date=1330218634]

@Davidi2
game and cards came out first bro
[/quote]First Pokemon cards were published in 1996 in Japan. First Digimon cards were in 1997 in Japan. Pokemon cards came to American in 1998, but:

Bandai of America decided to cancel the Digimon Card Game indefinitely, outside of Japan, for lack of interest. But the Japanese card quality is often more standard than America version. Some cards in America also had the wrong name, such as Ebonwumon’s card printed as Zhuqiaomon, and vice-versa.

Your argument is invalid

the digimon tamigotchi came out before pokemon cards/games/shows.
[/quote]Yea I know, but they stole that from the other tamigotchi anyways. Seeing as how Pokemon never actually used that idea, it’s irrelevant.

they did to… <,< what do you think Virtual Pikachu is?

a micro gameboy (with no color.)[/quote]
… its a tamagotchi… just with a different plastic coating… most of the buttons are just for show…/dont move…

Read full topic

Bandai of America decided to cancel the Digimon Card Game indefinitely, outside of Japan, for lack of interest. But the Japanese card quality is often more standard than America version. Some cards in America also had the wrong name, such as Ebonwumon’s card printed as Zhuqiaomon, and vice-versa.

Your argument is invalid

the digimon tamigotchi came out before pokemon cards/games/shows.
[/quote]Yea I know, but they stole that from the other tamigotchi anyways. Seeing as how Pokemon never actually used that idea, it’s irrelevant.

they did to… <,< what do you think Virtual Pikachu is?[/quote]
a micro gameboy (with no color.)

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

game and cards came out first bro
[/quote]First Pokemon cards were published in 1996 in Japan. First Digimon cards were in 1997 in Japan. Pokemon cards came to American in 1998, but:

Bandai of America decided to cancel the Digimon Card Game indefinitely, outside of Japan, for lack of interest. But the Japanese card quality is often more standard than America version. Some cards in America also had the wrong name, such as Ebonwumon’s card printed as Zhuqiaomon, and vice-versa.

Your argument is invalid

the digimon tamigotchi came out before pokemon cards/games/shows.[/quote]Yea I know, but they stole that from the other tamigotchi anyways. Seeing as how Pokemon never actually used that idea, it’s irrelevant.

item.title: Digimon vs Pokemon
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

reyx7:

I liked the simplicity of Yu Gi Oh cards. I still have a few decks made up. However I do have over 4000 Pokemon cards under my bed in filled binders. I’ll probably sell a mass of them when/if cards ever bounce back. Computers have practically destroyed the trading card market.

I had thousands of Yu-Gi-Oh cards in 4th grade. I taught my dad how to play and we battled each other all the time. Than we moved houses and I left them all besides the god cards and my Exodious set, (if that was the name of that monster), which I kept in a binder that I packed as soon as I heard we were moving. Than in 6th grade or something I went to my friends house and saw he had a secret stash of YuGiOh cards in his closet. For the rest of that summer, me, Chris (the friend), and Steven (the friend’s stepbrother), played YuGiOh when no one else was around. Fun fun fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Digimon vs Pokemon
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:39, topic:434093”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=536811.msg3925401#msg3925401 date=1330173094]

Pokemon didn’t rip off digimon… so using that as a reason is retarded.

This.

I have pokemon figurines so therefore I am a biased party, but Pokemon is better.
Offtopic: My favorite pokemon was blastoise. <3

Feraligatr

In my opinion, Digimon has the bosser looking monsters. Pokemon is better because it was a bigger success.

You would be better comparing digimon to yu-gi-oh.
[/quote]
yugioh cards are the most successful card game right now. Its super popular for no reason
plus yugioh is a continuous show
i think digimon creations look more like gundam and pokemon mixed together[/quote]

Gundam???

Yugioh was cool because of the big monsters and the fact that it had a more structured game play. I’m not even sure how to play digimon, my brother and I used to play it like War.

Read full topic
